title: Osher Günsberg responds to his jaw-dropping stuff up on The Masked Singer Australia
text:
On Tuesday night's episode of The Masked Singer Australia the Unicorn was finally unmasked as singer Deni Hines.

But those watching at home were more concerned with the error host Osher Günsberg made, introducing her as the 'only Australian to have written a song for Beyonce!'

Now the 45-year-old has put his gaffe down to the fact he was simply 'caught up in the moment'.

'I was caught up in the moment!' Osher Günsberg has hit back after he was mocked for embarrassing Deni Hines gaffe on The Masked Singer Australia on Tuesday night

Osher later apologised for the embarrassing blunder in two separate Tweets.

'... My apologies, I was caught up in the moment, my apologies to Sia,' he wrote to one fan.

The lovable host also replied to music journalist Cameron Adams who referenced Luke Steele from Empire of the Sun's writing work.

On Tuesday night's episode of The Masked Singer Australia the Unicorn was finally unmasked as singer Deni Hines

Wrong! Osher (pictured) incorrectly quipped: 'You are THE ONLY Australian to have written a song for Beyonce!'

'Far out I got it REALLY wrong. Thanks for the pickup Cam! Sorry Luke,' he said.

After the incident, fans were quick to correct Osher, tweeting that other Australians had also written for the diva.

One person wrote: 'Deni's the only Australian to write a song for Beyonce? Ummm, Pretty Hurts by Sia much?'

What a boo boo! Osher later apologised for the mind-blowing blunder in two separate Tweets

Someone else Tweeted: 'Did @oshergunsberg just say Deni was the only Australian to write a song for Beyonce like @sia hasn't been in her basement for years'.

Another added: '#MaskedSingerAU actually @Sia is Australian and has also written songs for @Beyonce'.

Of course, Deni wrote the dance track Bienvenue for French group IAM, which featured Beyonce back in 2003.

A few in the mix! Fans were quick to correct Osher, Tweeting that other Australians had also written for the songstress

Sia has also worked on several tracks for Beyonce, including Pretty Hurts, Rise Up and Standing On The Sun.

Someone else watching at home Tweeted: 'Deni isn't the only Australian to have written for Beyoncé' alongside a Wikipedia entry for her song Rather Die Young.

It was co-written by Australian Luke Steele, from the band Empire of the Sun.
description: On Tuesday night's episode of The Masked Singer Australia the Unicorn was finally unmasked as singer Deni Hines.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
